Titolo Use Case: Associate a cohort with a Program of Study
Descrizione: A cohort is associated with a specific Program of Study offered by the department.

Titolo Use Case: Add listing of students to a cohort
Descrizione: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add multiple students to a cohort in a single operation.

Titolo Use Case: Add a single student to a cohort
Descrizione: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add a single student to a cohort.
When a student is added to a cohort, their eligibility for the associated Program of Study is verified.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can define the preferred sequence of classes for a cohort.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can assign specific quarters for each class in a sequence.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add new classes to an existing sequence for a cohort.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can include clinical classes or sections in the sequence for a cohort.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can create a new cohort, specifying the start month and year.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add new classes to the nursing department's system.
Classes can be categorized as either non-clinical or clinical by Program Administrators.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can specify details like course name, lecture room needs, and instructor for non-clinical classes.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can specify requirements for clinical classes, including clinical site and lab instructors.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can create new Programs of Study within the system.
Program Administrators maintain a structure for each Program of Study, listing all required classes, including both clinical and non-clinical.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can specify which classes are required for each Program of Study.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can generate reports of needed classes per quarter for planning purposes.
Reports of needed classes include information like sections needed, lab needs, and room requirements.
Program Administrators ensure that classes for a cohort do not have overlapping schedules.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add new clinical sites into the system.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can provide details like site name, contact person, and contact information for a clinical site.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add a new clinical lab section to an existing clinical class.
A clinical lab section includes information such as clinical site, instructor, and the schedule of the lab.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can enroll a registered student into a clinical lab section.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can remove a student from a clinical lab section.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can transfer a student from one clinical lab section to another within the same class.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can cancel a clinical lab section if no students are enrolled.
Program Administrators or Nursing Staff Members can add a new nursing student to the system.
A staff member can modify the sequence and timeline of classes for a part-time student.
The system can display a summary for cohorts, including students, program of study, class sequence, progress, and completion timeline.
The system can display a summary of labs held at each clinical site, including general info, dates, and times.
The system can display details of each clinical lab, including class name, section, enrolled students, and schedule.
The system can display a student's details, including name, ID, admission date, classes, credits, GPA, and cohort.
The system can display a printable summary of its log for audit and record-keeping purposes.
The system stores contact details for relevant parties, including staff, students, and instructors.
The system uses stored email addresses as the primary method for sending communications to users.
The system notifies users about routine matters like upcoming classes and schedule updates.
The system sends notifications when changes occur in clinical sections, such as capacity adjustments or cancellations.
The system notifies affected users of changes like class cancellations or schedule adjustments.
The system informs users of changes to a cohort's schedule or sequence, such as class cancellations or sequence adjustments.
The system sends notifications when there are changes affecting specific students, such as a change in status or clinical section.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can edit information related to cohorts, including program of study and class sequence.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can update information about a Program of Study, such as its name and required classes.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can edit details of a clinical site, including name, contact person, and address.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can update details for a clinical lab section, including schedule and contact information.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can update a nursing student's details, including status and program of study.
